solution_line_template: If Rayden bought three times as many ducks as Lily, then he has {rayden_duck_multiplier}*{lily_ducks} = <<{rayden_duck_multiplier}*{lily_ducks}={rayden_ducks}>>{rayden_ducks} ducks
He has {rayden_ducks}-{lily_ducks} = <<{rayden_ducks}-{lily_ducks}={rayden_more_ducks}>>{rayden_more_ducks} more ducks than Lily has.
Rayden also bought {rayden_geese_multiplier}*{lily_geese} = <<{rayden_geese_multiplier}*{lily_geese}={rayden_geese}>>{rayden_geese} geese, four times the geese that Lily bought.
He has {rayden_geese}-{lily_geese}= <<{rayden_geese}-{lily_geese}={rayden_more_geese}>>{rayden_more_geese} more ducks than Lily.
Altogether, Rayden has {rayden_more_geese}+{rayden_more_ducks} = <<{rayden_more_geese}+{rayden_more_ducks}={total_more_animals}>>{total_more_animals} more ducks and geese than Lily.
